Description: Fragment of an undyed, linen, plain weave textile with two simple edges preserved, one edge cut and one edge has a thin, applied cuff (8mm wide) in undyed linen which covers and fixes the warp threads at that edge, sewn on with undyed linen threads in running stitch; 10cm in from the cuff edge there are one band of tapestry, with a freize of floral and vegetal motifs (heart-shaped leaves in orange and red), also two kinds of flowers, one green and red and the other green, white and orange; the two simple edges appear brighter and show sewing holes and threads indicating that these edges were sewn under, and sewn together; all these elements indicate this piece is the sleeve of a tunic; 3cm above the cuff are supplementary wefts in undyed linen creating a decoration of parallel lines; the tapestry band is framed above and below by 2 picks of supplementary weft; plain weave: undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S/17); tapestry: warp-undyed linen (S/16), weft-orange, red, green, blue wool (S/44); sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: stored in black box; similar to 18226 and 18225
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
